com.oneops.certs.security.pem

Class PemUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oneops.certs.security.pem.PemUtils

  • public class PemUtils
extends Object
    Some utility methods to deal with private key, client cert and cacerts pem files.

    PEM or Privacy Enhanced Mail is a file format for storing and sending X.509v3 certificates. The PEM file contains Base64 encoded DER certificate data prefixed with a "-----BEGIN.." header and "-----END..." footer.

      • loadPrivateKey

        public static PrivateKey loadPrivateKey(String privateKeyPem,
                                        Optional<String> keyPassword)
                                 throws IOException,
                                        GeneralSecurityException
        Loads the private key in pem format. Provide a key password if the private key is encrypted.

        If the private key is encrypted, make sure the key is in PKCS#8 wrapped format which is not the default openssl format. To convert to the PKCS#8 format, use : cat enc-key.pem | openssl pkcs8 -topk8 -inform pem -outform pem [-nocrypt]

        Parameters:
        privateKeyPem - private key in Base64 encoded pem format.
        keyPassword - optional private key password.
        Returns:
        PrivateKey
        Throws:
        IOException
        GeneralSecurityException

      • encryptPrivateKey

        public static String encryptPrivateKey(PrivateKey privateKey,
                                       String password)
                                throws GeneralSecurityException,
                                       IOException
        Encrypt the private using a PBE_ALGO algorithm.
        Parameters:
        privateKey - PrivateKey
        password - private key password to encrypt.
        Returns:
        Encrypted PEM formatted private key.
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException
        IOException
        See Also:
        Openssl PKCS#8, Cipher Algos
